title: 'EFFECTIVE & OVERWHELMING' US sends CHILLING warning to North Korea amid WW3 fears
text:
'EFFECTIVE & OVERWHELMING' US sends CHILLING warning to North Korea amid WW3 fears 'EFFECTIVE & OVERWHELMING' US sends CHILLING warning to North Korea amid WW3 fears WASHINGTON will unleash an “effective and overwhelming” response if North Korea chooses to use nuclear weapons, US defence secretary James ‘mad dog’ Mattis has warned. PUBLISHED: 02:15, Fri, Feb 3, 2017 | UPDATED: 02:29, Fri, Feb 3, 2017 GETTY/REUTERS Relations between the US and South Korea are set to continue amid growing threats from Kim Jong-un 
Speaking during a two-day trip to South Korea, Gen. Mattis reassured Seoul that the US intends to maintain support amid increasing fears of North Korea’s nuclear capabilities. 
He said: "Any attack on the United States, or our allies, will be defeated, and any use of nuclear weapons would be met with a response that would be effective and overwhelming. Related articles 'Mad Dog' Mattis goes to Asia to underscore US commitment to allies 
"North Korea continues to launch missiles, develop its nuclear weapons programme and engage in threatening rhetoric and behaviour.” 
The Pentagon chief also told reporters North Korea should be concerned about the planned deployment of the US Terminal High Altitude Area Defence (THAAD) missile defence system in South Korea. 
He said: "There's only one reason that we even have this under discussion right now, and that is North Korea's activities. America and South Korea prepare for war against North Korea Tue, January 24, 2017 U.S. and South Korean marines participate in the endurance exercise in temperature below minus 20 degrees celsius under a scenario to defend the country from any possible attacks from North Korea. Play slideshow 1 of 18 North Korea continues to launch missiles, develop its nuclear weapons programme and engage in threatening rhetoric and behaviour James Mattis 
"THAAD is for defence of our allies' people, of our troops who are committed to their defence. 
"Were it not for the provocative behaviour of North Korea we would have no need for THAAD out here. 
“There's no other nation that needs to be concerned about THAAD other than North Korea.” EPA James Mattis spoke in Seoul during his first foreign visit as the US defence secretary 
Despite Mattis’ attempts to allay concerns about THAAD, China remains opposed to the missile defence system amid claims it will destabilise the regional security balance. 
South Korean Defence Minister Han Min-koo reaffirmed plans to deploy THAAD and said Mattis' visit to Seoul - his first trip abroad since he became defence secretary last month - was an indication of bright future for relations between the two countries. 
Han said: “Faced with a current severe security situation, Secretary Mattis' visit to Korea... also communicates the strongest warning to North Korea.” 
North Korea’s despotic leader Kim Jong-un has issued a number of nuclear threats to the US and South Korea and on Thursday news emerged that the hermit state’s main nuclear facility has been restarted and is now fully operational. 
Matts continued: "North Korea has often acted in a provocative way, and it's hard to anticipate what they do.” AFP Mattis and his South Korean counterpart reaffirmed the strong relations between the two countries 
He described his trip to South Korea and Japan as “a priority for President Trump’s administration” and he looks to maintain good relations with their main allies in Asia. 
"Two of the most enduring alliances that we have had have been between Japan and us, and of course South Korea and the United States, and together we confront the North Korean situation. 
"I want to listen to them, engage with their political leaders, listen to some of their briefs, get an understanding of their view of the situation.” Related articles
